SENT.plain: A 29-year-old man with Marfan's syndrome presented with sudden onset of central chest pain radiating to the back
Aortography revealed a massively dilated right sinus of Valsalva aneurysm, with moderate aortic regurgitation
Urgent surgery in the form of a Bentall procedure was successfully carried out
There was no evidence of either aortic rupture or dissection
Acute expansion of the aneurysm must have precipitated the symptoms
The patient was alive and well three months later
